|  Type Alias | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [AlgorithmIdentifier](./crypto.web5crypto.algorithmidentifier.md) |  |

|  [GenerateKeyOptions](./crypto.web5crypto.generatekeyoptions.md) |  |
|  [KeyType](./crypto.web5crypto.keytype.md) | <p>KeyType</p><p>The read-only <code>type</code> property indicates which kind of key is represented by the object.</p><p>It can have the following string values:</p><p>"secret": This key is a secret key for use with a symmetric algorithm. "private": This key is the private half of an asymmetric algorithm's <code>ManagedKeyPair</code>. "public": This key is the public half of an asymmetric algorithm's <code>ManagedKeyPair</code>.</p> |
|  [KeyUsage](./crypto.web5crypto.keyusage.md) | <p>KeyUsage</p><p>The read-only usage property indicates what can be done with the key.</p><p>An Array of strings from the following list:</p><p>"encrypt": The key may be used to encrypt messages. "decrypt": The key may be used to decrypt messages. "sign": The key may be used to sign messages. "verify": The key may be used to verify signatures. "deriveKey": The key may be used in deriving a new key. "deriveBits": The key may be used in deriving bits. "wrapKey": The key may be used to wrap a key. "unwrapKey": The key may be used to unwrap a key.</p><p>Reference: IANA "JSON Web Key Operations" registry https://www.iana.org/assignments/jose/jose.xhtml\#web-key-operations</p> |
|  [NamedCurve](./crypto.web5crypto.namedcurve.md) |  |
|  [PrivateKeyType](./crypto.web5crypto.privatekeytype.md) |  |
